description.narrative:
Supplies: Particular care will be taken in order to ensure good standards of quality in any type of procurement. Any procurement will be launched at local, national or international level, through open tender processes, following Greek, EU and ECHO rules and regulations on procurement processes. Oxfam will ensure that competent staff will supervise procurement and delivery at every stage of the processes. Oxfam will also ensure that any procurement undertaken by implementing partners will follow the same rules and regulation. When applicable, particular care will be taken in procuring the highest number of supplies on the local market. This particularly applies to Food and NFI. This component of the program is intended to support the integration of theMigrants and Refugees into the local environment and, at the same time, to provide additional financial support to the host communities. Food supplies (hot meals) will be procured through local catering services, observant of local rules and regulationsin matters of hygiene and public health.In possession of the necessary licenses to operate over the territory of Greece, including all certification, such as the HACCP certification, ISO certification and relevant certifications of Greek Food Safety Authority. Construction/rehabilitation programming will follow the same rules. In order to ensure good quality and durable materials and final products, Oxfam will deploy national and international experts (when needed) trough the entire procurement process, as well as during the construction/rehabilitation phases. Construction/rehabilitation works will be implemented with the agreement and support of civil and military authorities. Contractors will be in possession of the required EU/Greece certifications and will be able to provide the same documentation for the final products included in this proposal.
HRM: Oxfam currently has a strong, senior team in Greece consisting of both international and national staff, including a Country Representative, two Humanitarian Programme Managers, a Protection manager, a Gender and Protection Lead, a WASH PHE Advisor, an Advocacy and Policy Lead, two Logistics Officer, a MEAL Officer, a HR/Admin Officer and a Finance Officer. Since its formal registration as International Organisation in Greece in February 2016, we have been recruiting national staff, replacing roving staff where possible. Some of the crucial management and technical expert positions will continue to be filled by existing (international) staff to ensure continuity, quality and familiarity with Oxfam systems and procedures. The operations in Greece are supported and overseen by staff from different Departments (i.e. Humanitarian, HR, MEAL, Quality Finance and Control) in Oxfam Novib's headquarters inThe Hague. The Country Representative of Greece is line managed by the Head of the Humanitarian Department.Authorization, monitoring and control procedures are in place. The humanitarian response in Greece is part of a European Regional Response and therefore supported by a Regional Humanitarian Response Team (consisting of a Regional Program Lead, a Regional Right inCrisis Campaign Manager and a Regional Funding Coordinator). The Regional Program Lead is providing a functional steer to the Country Representative, ensuring programme consistency with the regional response strategy, sharing information and learnings and linkingrelevant programme/ expert staff. For technical support on Oxfam's key humanitarian competencies WASH, Emergency Food Security,Gender and Protection and for urgent scale up support can be provided by Oxfam's Global Humanitarian Team (GHT), which can provide technical expertise and advise and has Humanitarian Support Personal (HSP) available at very short notice. For the implementation of thisproposed programme, Oxfam in Greece will receive temporary HSP support on crucial positions until all proposed staff positions havebeen filled through recruitment.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
